item.title: A framework for automated anomaly detection in high frequency water-quality data from in situ sensors

description.p: Source: Rob J Hyndman
Link: A framework for automated anomaly detection in high frequency water-quality data from in situ sensors

River water-quality monitoring is increasingly conducted using automated in situ sensors, enabling timelier identification of unexpected values. However, anomalies caused by technical issues confound these data, while the volume and velocity of data prevent manual detection. We present a framework for automated anomaly detection in high-frequency water-quality data from in situ sensors, using turbidity, conductivity and river level data. After identifying end-user needs and defining anomalies, we ranked their importance and selected suitable detection methods.

Link: Predicting Sediment and Nutrient Concentrations in Rivers Using High Frequency Water Quality Surrogates
